transcript: Rost6v. At that moment Alexander turned his head and Rost6v saw the beloved features that were so deeply engraved on his memory. The Emperor was pale, his cheeks sunken and his eyes hollow, but the charm, the mildness of his features, was all the greater. Rost6v was happy in the assurance that the rumors about the Emperor being wounded were false. He was happy to be see- ing him. He knew that he might and even ought to go straight to him and give the message Dol- gorukov had ordered him to del
